summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Dr. Lisa M. Rocchio, a licensed clinical psychologist specializing in trauma, forensic assessment, and ethics. It details her extensive education, clinical experience, publications, presentations, and professional activities. The document appears to be part of legal proceedings, as indicated by the 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' header, suggesting she may be serving as an expert witness or consultant in a case. This document is a professional biography or curriculum vitae for Lisa Marie Rocchio, Ph.D., detailing her extensive committee memberships, professional advocacy work (including Congressional visits), legislative activities, professional affiliations, and community involvement, primarily in Rhode Island. It appears to be part of a larger legal filing, as indicated by the protective order header.

events.title: BCBSRI Quality Support Grant Awarded
events.description: Dr. Rocchio's practice, Lisa M. Rocchio, Ph.D. & Associates, Inc., was awarded a $222,764 grant as part of a Blue Cross Blue Shield of Rhode Island pilot program to improve behavioral health care.

events.title: APA Presentation on Consulting with Legal System
events.description: Dr. Rocchio presented at the American Psychological Association national meeting on 'Clinical and forensic consultation with the legal system' as part of a symposium on ethical issues.

events.title: Doctoral Dissertation Completion
events.description: Dr. Rocchio completed her Ph.D. at the University of Rhode Island with a dissertation titled 'The pursuit of beauty through thinness and the impact of advertising on college women's attitudes.'

events.title: APA Advocacy Visits for Medicare/Healthcare Reform
events.description: Lisa Rocchio participated in American Psychological Association-organized visits to Senators Jack Reed and Sheldon Whitehouse and Representatives David Cicilline and James Langevin regarding Medicare and healthcare reform.

keyFacts: Dr. Lisa M. Rocchio is a licensed clinical psychologist with expertise in trauma, forensic assessment, and ethics, and is a Clinical Assistant Professor at Brown University's Alpert Medical School.

Her CV indicates significant experience as a forensic expert, including mock trial participation, specialized training in forensic psychology, and numerous presentations on forensic assessment of trauma.
The document is marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER,' indicating it is part of sealed legal proceedings, likely where Dr. Rocchio is serving as an expert witness or consultant.
She received a substantial grant ($222,764) from Blue Cross Blue Shield of RI in 2020 for her practice's participation in a quality support pilot program.
Dr. Rocchio holds leadership positions in the American Psychological Association, including President-Elect of Division 56 (Trauma Psychology) and member of the APA Ethics Committee.
The document is a detailed professional biography for Lisa Marie Rocchio, Ph.D., a psychologist and advocate.

Rocchio engaged in repeated, organized advocacy visits with all four of Rhode Island's Congressional delegation (Senators Reed and Whitehouse, Representatives Cicilline and Langevin) from 2012 to 2016 on issues of Medicare and mental health reform.
Rocchio served on a Rhode Island state legislative commission co-chaired by Senator Joshua Miller and Representative David Bennett from 2013 to 2014.
The document shows no direct connection to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any associated criminal activities; it appears to be background material on a potential expert or witness.
The header indicates the document is part of a legal case file and is subject to a protective order.
